        public ClientGUI()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        initialize creates the new JFrame for the client and calls the createMenu method

      • createMenu

        private void createMenu()
        createMenu creates a bar in the top of the frame where users have the button option. From there, they can click help to get information about how to play the game.

      • checkWinCondition

        private void checkWinCondition()
        CheckwinCondition is called every time a position button (game button) is clicked. It checks if three or more buttons in a rows are pressed. If they are, tells the user with 3 X that they have won and the user with 3 O that they have lost. If all panels have been pressed and no player won, it shows them a message that they draw.

      • cleanBoard

        private void cleanBoard()

      • nextTurn

        private void nextTurn(boolean myTurn)
        nextTurn method
        Parameters:
        myTurn - a boolean with the decision of enabling disabling the game board for a player.

      • registerUser

        private void registerUser()
        registerUser method is called when the connect button is pressed by a client. It enables the disconnect and send buttons. It ask the client for a user name and the IP if the server they want to connect. It runs the runSocket method.

      • runSocket

        private void runSocket()
        runSocket method runs the client socket with the IP and port number of the server socket. Creates a new ObjectOputStream and InputListener methods. Creates a new thread with the created inputListener and starts said thread.

      • disconnectClient

        private void disconnectClient()
        disconnectClient method is called when a client socket is dropped and disconnected from the server. It shows a message telling the user they have been disconnected and it closes the GUI window.

      • getMainPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getMainPanel()
        getMainPanel method creates a JPanel that covers the whole frame and it's divided in two parts.
        Returns:
        panel a JPanel that covers the whole frame

      • getNorthPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getNorthPanel()
        getNorthPanel method creates a JPanel that holds a JLabel as a title for the game. It's located at the top of the frame
        Returns:
        panel a JPanel with the north part of the frame

      • getCenterPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getCenterPanel()
        getCenterPanel method creates a JPanel in the center of the frame. It is divided in two parts.
        Returns:
        panel a JPanel with the center part of the frame

      • getLeftPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getLeftPanel()
        getLeftPanel method creates 9 buttons that are used as the game board. It's located at the left side of the frame.
        Returns:
        panel a JPanel with the game board.

      • getRightPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getRightPanel()
        getRightPanel method creates a JPanel that covers the right side of the frame. It's divided in two parts.
        Returns:
        panel a JPanel with the right part of the frame.

      • getNorthRightPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getNorthRightPanel()
        getNorthRightPanel method creates a JPanel that covers the upper right side of the frame. It creates a JTextField where the client can enter a message. It creates a JButton that sends the message in the JTextfild to whichever other client is paired up with this instance of the clientGUI.
        Returns:
        panel a JPanel with a text field that sends messages across clients.

      • getCenterRightPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel getCenterRightPanel()
        getCenterRightPanel creates a JPanel that covers the center and southern part to the right of the frame. It's divided in two sections.
        Returns:

      • getCenterRightPanelNorth

        private javax.swing.JPanel getCenterRightPanelNorth()
        getCenterRightPanelNorth creates a JPanel that holds the messages that are being received by the client that the user is currently paired up with.
        Returns:
        a JPanel with a list model where the Client receives messages from other clients.

      • getCenterRightPanelSouth

        private javax.swing.JPanel getCenterRightPanelSouth()
        getCenterRightPanelSouth method creates a JPanel at the southern right side of the frame. It creates one button that the user uses to connect to the server and with another client. The connect JButton enables the rest of the functionality in the program. It creates a JButton that disconnects the user from the server and closes that client's socket.
        Returns:
        a JPanel with two buttons on it.

      • btnListener

        private java.awt.event.ActionListener btnListener()
        btnListener method Depending on the calling source, it performs different actions
        Returns:
        an ActionListener for the clicked button

      • positionListener

        private java.awt.event.ActionListener positionListener()
        postionListener method listens for the buttons in the game board and performs and actions base on which button was pressed.
